731873f-c.title: Islands - Barren Island - [Old Public School No. 120 - Horse disposal plant.]
731873f-c.text:
(1)
Barren Island, east from Flatbush Ave., showing (left) the old P.S. No. 120, the horse disposal plant and an old hangar used before the establishment of the Floyd Bennett Field (Manicipal airport).
Juuly 5, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same; a view northward, showing a somewhat closer view of the
horse disposal plant.
April 21, 1931.
L Sperr.
(3)
The same, showing a view northeast from Flatbush Ave., with the
smoke stack in the center background.
April 21, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

731866f-a.title: Islands - Barren Island - Roadway - [Water tower.]
731866f-a.text:
Barren Island, showing Roadway, which with its abutments was cleared to make way for a new park and approach to the Marine Bridge, which (when completed) will connect this section of Brooklyn with Rockaway. Because of the reconstruction involved, the evacuation of some 350
residents became necessary.
April 21, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, further north, showing a water tower and P.S. No. 120. (The only school ever built on the island). These were demolished in June 1936 with all the other buildings to make way for Marine Park.
April 21, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

731887f-a.title: Islands - Barren Island (North) - East shore.
731887f-a.text:
(1)
Parren Island, east shore, north from the foot of Hassock Street, showing, in the distance, a disposal plant for the conversion of dead animals into glue. This building, in disuse for years, because of its high chimney that was a menace to aviatore at Floyd Bennett Field, was
demolished in 1937.
July 26, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing a further view north. This pier, an old one,
near the disposal plant, was demolished in 1937.
July 5, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

731888f-a.title: Islands - Barren Island - [Jamaica Bay - Brooklyn.]
731888f-a.text:
Barren Island, in Jamaica Bay, Brooklyn. En the background are the hangars and Administration Building of Floyd Bennett Field. View 2 shows also the Marine Parkway Bridge to Rockaway.
CG ~ 170
P. L. Sperr  View 1: July 4, 193S 2
NO REPRODUCTIONS  View 2: July 24, 1937
